title: Charles-Tim
author: Charles-Tim
content: Hacked amount $2.7. Although, Tether has frozen $1.4 millionI created this on our local board because we Nigerians know many people among us are using this exchange. And this will be a warning again that if it is not your key, it is not your coin. Avoid saving on centralized exchanges. Move your coins to a noncustodial wallet and have the full control yourself.Quote from: https://blockchair.com/news/remitano-exchange-allegedly-hacked-for-27m-14m-frozen-by-tether--abb8167a95Crypto exchange Remitano experienced large withdrawals under suspicious circumstances on Sept. 14, with some blockchain analysts concluding that it may have been hacked. A total of $2.7 million worth of crypto has been withdrawn through the suspicious transactions. Tether has frozen one address the attacker allegedly used, potentially saving $1.4 million worth of customers’ crypto.Is deposit and withdrawal still available on Remitano or it has been disabled?

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: This one na problems wey dey with us be this we think say saving money for exchange go better pass to save for wallet onto say anytime we need am we fit just sell am immediately without having to go through rigorous ways, like to send from wallet to exchange and waiting to be fully confirmed before selling will waste time. This method na one thing wey we supposed dey avoid pass self but how we go do na, our people like easier thing than keep money on a noncostodial  wallet. Me self never try using this exchange since them dey existence I never near there instead then na whatsapp group p2p then luno come I begin dey use am before we moved to binance.Anyhow thanks for helpful update.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: I have known remitano to be in operation for some years now and I might have used it few times before I abandoned them for other better choice, but I never knew they are still very much active and still supplying service to customers within Nigeria, talk more of them having this high volume of crypto under their watch, how do people even happen to trust a crypto exchange like remitano to hold their funds? After the recent incident with Patricia I taught Nigeria would have learn to run out from storing their crypto on exchanges and try to hold it on their own personal wallet until when they want to exchange it then they can make use of any exchange that they care to use. If people are just making use of this exchanges just for the purpose of exchanges their crypto to fait, this exchange will have little holding volumes which will reduce hackers intention to hack them since their is literally nothing to few funds which could be hijacked from their. Let’s see what will happen after this, in one part this is one thing that most post people like about centralization, as tether have been able to take a quick action by frozen funds of the hackers on their wallets which will limit them of spending it, but everything always have its advantages as they can use such access in their own advantage over an innocent holders fund.

I would have to investigate further to know if this hack information is worse than could be managed or recovered from. In the meantime, can someone please advice on the next best exchange or custodial wallet to use, with easy features and better security protocol?

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: Remittano was smart enough to trace the wallet that the funds was transfer into immediately for Tether to freeeze, if not this would have been a big loss to the exchange and customers will be the ones at loss because most funds in exchanges belongs to customers. Self custody is the best way to be free from all these exchanges incapability to secure customers funds, because they are hackers target or an insider can still sell out information to hackers. Newbies like me, should take note of all these scenarios and use a noncustodial wallet for the safety our funds. Nothing sweet pass say anytime wey you want your funds, you fit get access to am.
